alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 1:35AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino and Yavapai Counties through 200 AM MST... At 135 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Village At Oak Creek, or near Sedona, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sedona, Village At Oak Creek and Red Rock State Park. This includes the following highways... State Route 179 between mile markers 302 and 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 371 and 375. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
